    • Method Detail

      • armPass

        private int armPass(column fromColumn,
                    column toColumn)
        Calculate the minimum required height for the arm to travel from the starting column to the ending column. Arm Pass Value = Maximum column height between the starting and ending column. This might include all column depending on the starting and ending column, such as; Target, Source, Temporary column and all the 6 bars
        Parameters:
        fromColumn - the starting column which the block will be picked from
        toColumn - the ending column which the block will be dropped in
        Returns:
        arm 2 calculated width

      • blockPass

        private int blockPass(column fromColumn,
                      column toColumn)
        Block pass.
        Parameters:
        fromColumn - the from column
        toColumn - the to column
        Returns:
        the int

      • calculateHeight

        private int calculateHeight(column fromColumn,
                            column toColumn)
        Calculate the minimum height required for Arm 1 to move the top block from the starting column to the end column. The height need to satisfy the following two rules: 1- Arm 2 should travel between the Starting and ending column without being blocked 2- The picked block should travel from the starting column to the ending column without being blocked
        Parameters:
        fromColumn - The starting column which the block will be picked from
        toColumn - The ending column which the block will be dropped in
        Returns:
        The calculated height for Arm 1

      • changeArmOneHeight

        private void changeArmOneHeight(int newHeight)
        Change Arm 1 height to a given value. It works in both directions, Up and Down.
        Parameters:
        newHeight - the new height for the arm

      • changeArmThreeDepth

        private void changeArmThreeDepth(int newDepth)
        Change Arm 3 depth to a given value. It works in both directions, lower and rise (up and down).
        Parameters:
        newDepth - the new depth for the arm

      • changeArmTwoWidth

        private void changeArmTwoWidth(int newWidth)
        Change Arm 2 width to a given value. It works in both directions, extend and contract (forward and backward).
        Parameters:
        newWidth - the new width for the arm

        Count occurrence of last block.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the int

      • dropBlock

        private void dropBlock(column fromColumn,
                       column toColumn)
        Drop the current picked block at a given column by doing the following steps: 1- Push the block into the end column stack 2- Pop the block from the starting column stack 3- Lower Arm 3 to a calculated depth based on the end column 4- Drop the block 5- Rise arm 3 to default position (depth =0) Arm 3 depth = Current depth - Column height - block height - 1.
        Parameters:
        fromColumn - the column which the block was picked from
        toColumn - the column which the block will be dropped in

      • pickBlock

        private void pickBlock(column fromColumn)
        Picks the top block from a given column. by doing the following steps: 1- Calculate the arm depth based on the total blocks height in the given column 2- Lowers arm 3 to the calculated depth 3- Picks the block 4- Rise Arm 3 Depth to 0 Arm 3 starting depth is always 0
        Parameters:
        fromColumn - the column which contains the block

      • printDebugVariables

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the height of the block which has being removed
